Hi!

Welcome to Javascript Query Language − The modern SQL in the DOM!

JSQL:

is a lightweight library built on-top of the Javascript Runtime Engine(JRE). It was an idea conceived as at June 2019. The goal was to make DOM data fetching / query as seemless like an SQL data model


INTRODUCTION: JSQL works with the Document Object Model(DOM) and The Window Object Model(WOM), thus using it's rich query engine to expose all dataset available in the DOM & WOM table. JSQL tends to use the SQL-LIKE SELECT pattern to neglect the complex traditional javascript DOM & window getter / parser. it handles the DOM & WOM as the table for it data schemes.


INSTALLATION : Import the JSQL library / dependencies on your application (You may include at the HEAD or before the closing body section of the page)

‹script src="path/to/folder/jsql.zero.min.js"/›

You may choose to install the minified version(jsql.zero.min) or the raw version(jql.zero.raw) of JSQL which contains all commenting and code structure.


JSQL METHODS:

JSQL on the DOM: you can select any of the following data field [text, html,* (html dataset), value(from form fields) or attributes(class, id, e.t.c)]

1. jsql.run("SELECT * FROM document"); //or [SELECT * from DOM]

2. jsql.run("SELECT text FROM document");

3. jsql.run("SELECT html FROM document");

4. jsql.run("SELECT value FROM document");

5. jsql.run("SELECT text FROM document WHERE element = '.selector' "); //you may use any css selector such as [tags, class, id, attribute e.t.c]

6. jsql.run("SELECT class FROM document WHERE element != '#selector'"); //you may use any css selector such as [tags, class, id, attribute e.t.c]

NOTE: The JSQL DOM query is case insensitive. Therefore using [DOM] is same as using [dom]



JSQL on the WOM: you can select any property available on the windows object such as userAgent, location, screen, client, browser e.t.c

1. jsql.run("SELECT location FROM window"); //or [SELECT location from WOM]

2. jsql.run("SELECT navigator.userAgent FROM window");

3. jsql.run("SELECT href FROM window WHERE property = 'location' "); //you may use any window property with the WHERE clause when dealing with chained / object properties

4. jsql.run("SELECT that FROM window WHERE property != 'property' "); //you cannot use the NOT operator when dealing with windows object, therefore this query will return an error

NOTE: The JSQL WOM query is case insensitive. Therefore using [WOM] is same as using [wom]
